meanings.definition: Attempt to explain or justify behavior or an attitude with logical reasons.
meanings.sent1: She tried to rationalise her decision to stay up late by saying she needed to finish her homework.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to rationalise his actions, but sometimes they just don't make sense.
meanings.sent3: It was hard not to laugh when he tried to rationalise eating ice cream for breakfast as a healthy choice.
meanings.sent4: She tried to rationalise her fear of spiders by convincing herself they were just misunderstood creatures.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to rationalise his controversial statement only made things worse.

meanings.definition: Organize or change something in a way that makes it more efficient or logical.
meanings.sent1: She needed to rationalise her closet to fit all her clothes in neatly.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to rationalise their production process to reduce waste.
meanings.sent3: He had to rationalise his schedule to make time for all his activities.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to rationalise the lesson plan to make it easier for the students to understand.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to rationalise the kitchen layout to improve workflow and efficiency.
